= 23 - 5

18 = R.H.S

question:
By interchanging the given two signs and numbers which of the following equationwill be correct?

× and +, 6 and 4
solution:
(d)

7 × 6 – 4 + 9 ÷ 3 = –7

After changing the signs and numbers as per given instructions we get,

7 + 4 – 6 x 9 ÷ 3 = – 7

From L.H.S,

= 7 + 4 - 18

-7 = R.H.S

question: In a certain code language, 'INNER’ is written as 'SNNWJ' and 'GLASS' is written as'UPAII'. How will 'MODEL' be written in that language?
solution:
(b) Logic:Sum of place value of letters of given word and their respective Code letters should be 28. i.e.
For INNER → SNNWJ ⇒ 28-I=S, 28-N=N, 28-N=N, 28-E=W, 28-R=J
For GLASS → UPAII ⇒ 28-G=U, 28-L=P, 28-A=A, 28-S=I, 28-S=I
Similarly, For MODEL ⇒ 28-M=O, 28-O=M, 28-D=X, 28-E=W, 28-L=P

question:
Select the option that is related to the third number in the same way as the second
number is related to the first number and the sixth number is related to the fifth number.
30 : 48 :: 60 : ? :: 45 : 72
solution:
(a) Logic:a : b → Their simplest form must be 5 : 8

In 30 : 48→ (30÷6) : (48÷6) = 5 : 8

In 60 : 96→ (60÷12) : (96÷12) = 5 : 8

In 45 : 72 → (45÷9) : (72÷9) = 5 : 8

question: How many types of taxes were in the reign of the ruler Alauddin Khalji?
solution: (a) Alauddin Khilji(1296-1316) imposed 3 types of taxes: Jaziya (religious tax on Hindu community), Ghari tax (tax on Houses), and Chari tax (tax on cattles). He resisted the Mongol invasion more than 12 times. He followed the Divine Right Theory of Kingship. He was the first to bring the standing army system. He died in 1316 A.D.

question: The bare ground between plants is covered with a layer of organic matter in order toretain soil moisture. This method is called ______.
solution: (a) Mulching. Rock dams are Small dams made up of stone, bagged sand or gravel, or other long-lasting material through drainage. A shelterbelt is defined as a barrier of trees and shrubs that provides protection from wind and storm and decreases erosion. Contour barriers are simply contour strips or barricading created to slow down the water and soil particles flowing downwards.

question: In which of the following years was the Fit India Movement launched by Ministry ofYouth Affairs and Sports, GoI?
solution: (d)Fit India Movement was launched in 2019 on the occasion of National Sports Day to make fitness an integral part of the daily lives of the people of India. National Sports Day is celebrated on 29 August every year, on the birth anniversary of hockey legend Major Dhyan Chand.

question: Husk of a coconut is made of ______ tissue.
solution: (c)The husk of coconut is made of sclerenchymatous tissue (provide strength to plants). Tissues of Plants: Dermal Tissues {epidermal cells, stomata, trichomes}, Ground tissues {Collenchyma (provide mechanical strength and elasticity to plants), parenchyma (to store food and provide turgidity to organ), sclerenchyma}, and Vascular tissue {Vessel elements, tracheids, companion cells and sieve tubes}. Xylem is a vascular tissue that transports water throughout a plant's body.

question: Which of the following options is NOT correct about plant cells?
option_1: Cell wall of a plant cell is made up of cellulose.
option_2: The plant cells cannot divide by mitosis.
option_3: A plant cell usually contains a large vacuole.
option_4: Generally, all plant cells contain chloroplast.
solution: (b) Plantsgo through mitosis and meiosis both.Mitosis in plants happens in the meristems of the plant that are located at the tip of the stems and roots. Meiosis, a specialized cell division to produce haploid cells, marks the transition from a sporophytic to a gametophytic generation in the life cycle of plants. Plant cell consists of :- Ribosome, Golgi Vesicles, Smooth Endoplasmic Reticulum, Nucleolus, Nucleus, Large Central Vacuole, Amyloplast (Starch Grain), Cell wall, Cell Membrane, Golgi Apparatus, Vacuole Membrane, Chloroplast, Raphide Crystal, Druse Crystal, Mitochondria, Cytoplasm etc.

question: The Government of India started DACE scheme in April 2022. This scheme waslaunched under which of the following ministries?
solution: (a)Dr Ambedkar Centres of Excellence (DACE) Scheme was launched by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment on 22nd April, 2022. It aims to provide high-quality free coaching facilities to the Scheduled Caste students for the UPSC Civil Services examinations. A total of 100 seats (33% of seats for eligible female candidates of Scheduled Castes) will be sanctioned for each coaching centre.

question: Whose birthday is celebrated as International Day of Non-Violence?
solution: (d)The International Day of Non-Violence is observed on 2 October (birthday of Mahatma Gandhi). 2022 theme: ‘Say No to Violence’. Mahatma Gandhi returned to India from South Africa on 9th January 1915. Every year 9th January is celebrated every year as Pravasi Bharatiya Divas (PBD) to mark the contribution of the Overseas Indian community in the development of India. 2022 theme: “Contributing to Atma Nirbhar Bharat”.

question: Which of the following Indian freedom fighter said that "Be the change you wish to see in the world"
solution: (d) Mahatma Gandhi. His other Famous Quotes: “A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.”, “Nobody can hurt me without my permission.”, “The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.”, “Nearly everything you do is of no importance, but it is important that you do it.”, “Nonviolence is a weapon of the strong.”, “An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.”, etc.

question: In which year was Kalidas Samman established?
solution: (d)The Kalidas Samman was first awarded in 1980. It is an arts award presented annually by the government of Madhya Pradesh in India. 1980-81 (Semmangudi Srinivasa Iyer and Mallikarjun Mansur). 2022 {Pandit Venkatesh Kumar (Hindustani vocalist and belong to Kirana and Gwalior Gharana).

question: Who among the following has won Oscars as well as a Golden Globe award for hiscontribution to international music?
solution: (b) A.R. Rahmanis a winner of six National Film Awards (1992, 1996, 2001, 2002, 2007), two Oscar Awards (2009 and 2011), Padma Shri (2000), Padma Bhushan (2010) two Grammy Awards (both in 2009), a BAFTA Award (2009), a Golden Globe Award (2009), fifteen Filmfare Awards and seventeen Filmfare Awards South.

question: Asia is separated from Europe by ______ mountains.
solution: (d) Ural mountainsseparate the continents of Europe and Asia. Alps mountain (natural boundary between France and Italy), Andes Mountains range (South American countries of Chile and Argentina), Himalaya (plains of the Indian subcontinent from the Tibetan Plateau). Caucasus mountains (Asia and Europe).

question: Which of the following states have the highest literacy rate, according to census 2011?
solution: (d)According to Census 2011: Top Literate States: Kerala (94.00 %) followed by Lakshadweep, Mizoram, Goa, and Tripura. Most Populated Metros: Mumbai followed by Delhi, Kolkata, Chennai, and Bangalore.

question: The system based on individual leadership is a __________ system.
solution: (c) Presidential.A presidential system is one in which the head of state is also the head of government, and the executive branch is independent of the legislative branch. Parliamentary system is a form of government where executives hold the power with the majority support of the legislature. A semi-presidential system is a republican system of governance that combines elements of presidential democracy with parliamentary democracy.

question: Which of the following rivers is NOT included in the ‘Panchnad’?
solution: (c) The Indus.The Panjnad is the name given to the five rivers of Punjab, namely the Satluj, the Beas, the Ravi, the Chenab and the Jhelum. All of the 5 rivers are tributaries of the Indus river. The Indus river comes from a glacier in Bokhar Chu in the Tibetan area, in the Kailash Mountain range close to Mansarovar Lake. The river passes through Pakistan, India, and China’s Tibetan areas.

question: The final of the French Open (Roland Garros) Tennis 2021 for men took place on whichday?
solution: (a) 2021 French Openwas held at the Stade Roland Garros in Paris, France, from 30 May to 13 June 2021. French Open 2022 (22 May 2022 – 5 June 2022): Men’s Singles {Rafael Nadal (Spain)}, Women’s Singles {Iga Świątek (Poland)}, Men’s doubles {Marcelo Arevalo ( El Salvador), Jean-Julien Rojer (Netherlands)}, Women’s doubles{Caroline Garcia (French), Kristina Mladenovic (French)}, Mixed doubles {Ena Shibahara (JAPAN), Wesley Koolh of (Netherlands)}.

question: Union Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri inaugurated Asia’slargest Compressed Bio Gas (CBG) plant in _____.
solution: (c)(Lehragaga, Sangrur, Punjab on 18th October). The project was commissioned with a foreign direct investment (FDI) of Verbio AG company (Germany). It is a step towards achieving the goals of the Sustainable Alternative Towards Affordable Transportation (SATAT) scheme. Punjab {Capital: Chandigarh, Governor: Banwarilal Purohit, Chief minister: Bhagwant Mann (As of December 2022).

question: Identify the correct statement with respect to unsaturated hydrocarbons.
option_1: Compounds of carbon having a single bond between their carbon atoms are called unsaturated compounds.
option_2: Compounds of carbon having double bonds or triple bonds between their carbon atoms are called unsaturated compounds.
option_3: Compounds of carbon having single bonds between their oxygen atoms are called unsaturated compounds.
option_4: Compounds of carbon having double or triple bonds between their hydrogen atoms are called unsaturated compounds.
solution: (b) Unsaturated hydrocarbons are organic compounds that are entirely made up of carbon and hydrogen atoms and consist of a double or a triple bond between two adjacent carbon atoms. Types: Alkenes or Olefins (at least one double bond between two adjacent carbon atoms, CnH2n), Alkynes (minimum of one triple bond between two carbon atoms that are positioned adjacent to each other, CnH2n-2), Cyclic hydrocarbons (at least one double or triple bond between two carbon atoms), and Aromatic Hydrocarbons (ring-shaped hydrocarbons containing delocalised pi electrons).

question: Some important administrative posts were hereditary during the Rashtrakuta and Chola dynasties. The post ‘nagara-shreshthi’ meant?
solution: (b) Nagara-Shreshthi means merchant of the city. The Rashtrakuta empire was divided into administrative units known as Rashtras or Vishayas, which were directly ruled by the monarch. Vishyas were further subdivided into Bhuktis. Each Bhuktis was made up of a number of villages. The Chola Empire was divided into nine provinces, called “Mandalams” which was further divided into a number of districts, or zillas, known as “Valanadus”.

question: Which of the following is added in the national income to obtain personal income ofthe households?
solution: (b) Personal Income = National Income - Corporate Income Taxes - Undistributed Corporate Profits - Social Security Contribution + Transfer Payments.Personal Income (PI) is the total money income received by individuals and households of a country from all possible sources before direct taxes.

question: Who conducted X-ray spectroscopic study of a large number of elements and showedthat the frequency of X-rays emitted by an element is related to the atomic number, Z, rather than the atomic mass?
solution: (c) Henry Moseley. Lothar Meyerproposed that in arranging the elements to increase atomic weights, similarities appear in physical and chemical properties. In 1829, Johann Dobereiner recognised triads of elements with chemically similar properties, such as lithium, sodium and potassium. Dmitri Mendeleev devised the periodic classification of the chemical elements, in which the elements were arranged in order of increasing atomic weight.

question: Which Five-Year Plan in India was mainly focussed on Garibi Hatao, creation ofemployment opportunities and agricultural production amongst other objectives?
solution: (a) Fifth Five year Plan. Its duration was1974-1979. This plan was terminated in 1978 by the newly elected Moraji Desai government. The Electricity Supply Act was amended in 1975, a Twenty-point program was launched in 1975, the Minimum Needs Programme (MNP) and the Indian National Highway System was introduced. Second Five Year Plan (1956 to 1961), Its main focus was on the industrial development of the country. Third Five Year Plan (1961 to 1966), plan is also called ‘Gadgil Yojna’. Fourth Five Year Plan (1969 to 1974), main objectives of this plan was growth with stability and progressive achievement of self-reliance.

question: What are the two most essential rights of a democracy?
solution: (b)Two most essential rights of Democracy are Right to equality and right to freedom. Democracy is a form of government in which rulers are elected by the people in a free and fair elections, on universal adult franchise and governed on the basis of certain fundamental rules like a constitution. Types of Democracy: Direct democracy and Representative democracy.

question: In March 2022, the “Stree Manoraksha project” was launched by which of the followingUnion Minister?
option_2: Union Minister for Women and Child Development
option_4: Union Minister for Health and Family Welfare
solution: (b)The ‘Stree Manoraksha Project’ has been launched by the Ministry of Women and Child Development (MoWCD) in collaboration with NIMHANS Bengaluru. This was launched with the aim to improve women’s mental health across India. NIMHANS (National Institute of Mental Health and Neuro-Sciences): Established (1847 as Lunatic Asylum, 1925 as Mental Hospital, 27 December 1974 as NIMHANS), Location (Bangalore, Karnataka).

question: Jata-Jatin is the folk dance of which Indian state?
solution: (c) Jat-Jatin is famous among the northern parts of Bihar, especially Mithila. Dances of Bihar: Karma Dance, Jhijhiya Dance, Kajri Dance, Jhumar Dance, Bhojpuri Jhumar Dance, Magahi Jhumar Dance, Jharni Dance, etc.

question: Mughal ruler, Aurangzeb died in which year?
solution: (c) On March 3, 1707, Aurangzeb died in central India. Aurangzeb (Alamgir’) was the sixth Mughal Emperor of India, ruled from 1658 to 1707. He reimposed the religious tax Jizya on non- muslims in 1679. The first ten years of his reign are documented in Muhammad Kazim's Alamgir Nama. He was also known for assassinating Guru Tegh Bahadur, a Sikh leader who refused to convert to Islam. In 1667, he gave the French permission to build a factory in Surat.

question: In an equilateral triangle ABC, D is the midpoint of side BC. If the length of BC is 8 cm,then the height of the triangle is:
solution:
(d)

Height of equilateral triangle = a32 = 832 = 43 cm

question: A thief steals a bike at 12:30 p.m. and drives it at 48km/h. But the theft is discoveredafter half an hour. The bike owner starts to chase him on another bike at 58km/h. The thief will be caught at ______.
solution:
(d)

Distance travelled by thief before he discovered = 48×12 = 24 km Now, the relative speed of bike owner and thief = 58 - 48 = 10 km/h Time taken by bike owner to catch thief = 2410 = 125hr = 2hr 24 min. Time at which thief caught = 12 : 30 pm + 30 min + 2hr 24min = 3 : 24 pm

question: If ∆ABC~∆FDE such that AB = 9 cm, AC = 11 cm, DF = 16 cm and DE = 12 cm, then the length of BC is:
solution:
(d)

If two triangles are similar then the ratio of their corresponding sides are equal. If ,∆ABC ~ ∆FDE Then, ABFD = BCDE ⇒ 916 = BC12 ⇒ BC = 634cm

question: The radii of two cylinders are in the ratio 1 : 4 and their heights are in the ratio 4 : 3.Their volumes will be in the ratio ______.
solution:
(a)

Volume of cylinder = πr2h Let the radius of cylinders are x and 4x and height of the cylinder are 4y and 3y respectively. πr12h1 : πr22h2 x2×4y : 4x2×3y 4 : 48 1 : 12

question: If x + 1x = 2cosθ , then x3 + 1x3 = ?
solution:
(c)

cos3θ = 4cos3θ-3cosθ x+1x = 2cosθ …..(given) Then x3+1x3 = 2 cosθ3-3×2 cosθ = 24cos3θ-3cosθ = 2 cos3θ

question: A and B can do a certain work in 6 hours, and A, B and C together take 4 hours to dothe same. How long will it take for C alone to accomplish the task?
solution:
(a)

Now , efficiency of C = efficiency of (A+B+C) - efficiency of (A+B)

efficiency of C = 3 - 2 = 1

Total work = 12 units

Time taken by C to complete task alone =121 = 12 hours

question: Ifx = 3 + 22 , x > 0, then the value of x - 1x is:
solution:
(c)

x = 3+22 x = 22+(1)2+22 = 2+12 x = 2+1 ……eq.(1) Taking reciprocal of eq.(1) , we get 1x = 12+1×2-12-1 = 2-11 = 2-1 ……eq.(2) Now, From eq.(1) and eq.(2), we get, x-1x = 2+1 - 2-1= 2

question:
Study the given graph and table and answer the following question. Data of different states regarding population of states in the year 1998

Total population of the given states = 32760000

If in the year 1998, there was an increase of 20% in the population of Goa and 10% in the population of Arunachal Pradesh compared to the previous year, then what was the ratio of populations of Goa and Arunachal Pradesh in 1997?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675230539/word/media/image43.png
https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675230539/word/media/image44.png
solution:
(b)

Population of goa in 1998 = 32760000×12100 = 3931200 Population of Arunachal Pradesh in 1998 = 32760000×25100 = 8190000 According to question , Population of goa in 1997 : Population of Arunachal Pradesh in 1997 3931200×100120 : 8190000×100110 32760×11 : 819000 36036 : 81900 11×3276 : 25×3276 11 : 25

question: Suman paid ₹9,600 in interest on a loan she obtained 5 years ago with a simpleinterest rate of 16%. What was the amount of the loan she had taken?
solution:
(c)

Simple Interest = P×R×T100 9600 = P ×16×5100 P = 9600×10080 = Rs 12000

question: tan(θ- 14π) is equal to:
solution:
.63.(a)

tanθ-14π=[tan-{(14π-θ)}]=-tan(14π-θ)Value of tanθ and cotθ in-ve in fourth quadrant.-tan(14π-θ)=-(-tanθ)=tanθ

question: What will be the remainder when 742 is divided by 48?
solution:
(c)

If expression a+1n is divisible by (a) , then remainder will be always +1n 742 = 7221 = 4921 = 48+121 When 48+121 is divisible by 48 , remainder will be +121 = 1

question:

question: Number p is 15% more than 150. If k is 15% less than p, then k is equal to:
solution:
(d)

According to the question , Number p = 150×115100 = 172.5 Now, Number k = 172.5×85100 = 146.625

question: What is the HCF of 36 and 198?
solution:
(c)

Factor of 36 and 198 .

36 = 2×2×3×3

198 = 2× 3×3×11

H.C.F. (36,198) = 2×3×3 = 18

question: The cost of a piece of diamond varies with the square of its weight. A diamond ofRs.6,084 value is cut into 3 pieces whose weights are in the ratio 3 : 2 : 1. Find the loss involved in the cutting.
solution:
.68.(b)

Given , the weight of diamond after cutting into 3 pieces is 3x : 2x : x Total weight before cutting be 6x. According to question , Price varies with the square of its weight , Then , Price of diamond before cutting = 36x2 Total price after cutting =9x2+ 4x2+x2 = 14x2 Loss incurred =36x2 - 14x2 = 22x2 Now, 36x2= Rs. 6084 x = 13 Loss = 22 ×13 ×13 = Rs 3718

question: The marked price of an article is ₹10,927. Due to festive season, a certain percentage ofdiscount is declared. Raju buys an article at reduced price and sells it at ₹10,927, and makes a profit of 11.5%. What was the percentage discount offered?
solution:
.69.(a)

Raju makes a profit of 11.5% by selling article at Rs. 10927 .

Cost price =10927×100111.5 = Rs. 9800

Now , the discount that Raju gets due to festive seasons = 10927 - 9800 = 1127 Rs.

Discount % =112710927×100 = 10.3%

Short Tricks:-

Discount % = 23223×100 = 10.3%


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/admin/resources/qdocs/test-1-EN-1/1675230539/word/media/image49.png

question: If x + 1x= -2, then what is the value of x17+ x-17 + x12 + x-12? (x < 0)
solution:
.70.(d)

when x+1x= -2 then x = -1 Now , x17+x-17+x12+x-12 = -1 -1 +1 +1 = 0

question: Find the mean proportion between (6+8 ) and (3-2).
solution:
(b)

Mean proportional between a and b is ab . Mean proportional of 6+8 and 3-2 = 6+83-2 = 18-62+38-16 = 18-62+62-4=14

question: If x - y = 1 and x2 + y2 = 41 where x, y ≥ 0, then the value of x + y will be:
solution:
.72.(a)

Given that , x-y = 1 and x2+y2 = 41 Now , x-y2=x2+y2-2xy 1 = 41-2xy ⇒ xy = 20 Now by using formula, x+y2=x2+y2+2xy x+y2=41+2×20 = 81 x + y = 9

question: ΔXYZ ~ ΔGST and XY : GS = 2 : 3, XV is the median to the side YZ, and GD is the median to the side ST. The value of YVSD2is ______.
solution:
(a)

If two triangles are similar then the ratio of their corresponding sides are equal.

If , ∆XYZ ~ ∆GST Then XYGS = YZST …….eq.(1) YV = YZ2 and SD = ST2 …..eq.(2) Putting the value of eq.(2) in eq.(1) , we get XYGS = 2YV2SD = 23 ⇒ YVSD2 = 49

question: Vikas covered a certain distance by bike. If he covers 40% of the distance at 40 km/h,50% of the distance at 25 km/h and the remaining 10% distance at 10 km/h. Find his average speed over the whole distance.
solution:
(a)

Let the total distance be 10 units

Average speed =total distance travelled total time taken

Average speed =10440+525+110 = 10×20020+40+20 = 25 km/h

question:
The table given below shows the production of refrigerator by 6 companies.

What is the ratio of production of refrigerator by company G to the production of refrigerator by company I?


https://ssccglpinnacle.com/images/mceu_37851686911683782489049.png
solution:
(c)

Production of refrigerator by company G = 260

Production of refrigerator by company I = 220

Required ratio = 260 : 220 ⇒ 13 : 11

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

Oscar is the most prestigious award which isintroduced to good actors in that year.
solution:
(c)awarded to best.

Oscars are ‘awards’ which are generally awarded and not introduced. Moreover, we will use a superlative degree adjective(best) for the actors getting the award. Hence, ‘awarded to best’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

When I reached home late, I found my childrenwaiting on me.
solution:
(d)waiting for me.

There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition ‘on’ must be replaced with ‘for’ because we generally use the preposition ‘for’ with the verb ‘wait’. Hence, ‘waiting for me’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

Our school had decided to take us to the Himalayas for excursion. I ________ to convince my mother to give consent.
solution:
(d) left no stones unturned

‘Left no stones unturned’ is an idiom that means to do everything you can to achieve a good result. The given sentence states that the narrator did everything to convince his mother to give consent. Hence, ‘left no stones unturned’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
79.Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word in the given sentence.

The rhime and rhythm of Papai’s poems are highly symbolical and timely.
solution:
(a)Rhime.

‘Rhyme’ is the correct spelling.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(b)Judege.

‘Judge’ is the correct spelling.

question: Select the sentence with the appropriate use of adverb of frequency.
option_1: Radha goes to Nagpur with great affection.
option_2: Radha goes to Nagpur for her office work.
option_4: Radha goes to Nagpur to meet her uncle.
solution:
(c) Radha often goes to Nagpur.

An adverb of frequency is a word that can be placed after the noun or pronoun in a sentence to give more information about the verb, adjective or another adverb. Some examples of adverbs of frequency are rarely, often, always, never and sometimes. Similarly, ‘often’ as an adverb of frequency is perfectly used in option ‘c’. Hence, ‘Radha often goes to Nagpur’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.

Obligatory
solution:
(b)Compulsory- that must be done, by law, rules, etc.

Obligatory- that you must do

Unnecessary- more than is needed or acceptable

Chosen- to decide or prefer to do something

Optional- available to be chosen but not obligatory.

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.
Built by King Narasimhadeva I of the Eastern Ganga dynasty from 1238-1250 CE, the13th century late-style Kalingan temple forms part of the golden triangle of Odisha,along with Puri and Bhubaneswar, and attracts tourists, pilgrims, and history and art lovers.
solution:
(d)Deters- to make somebody decide not to do something

Attracts- to cause somebody to like somebody/something

Embodies- to be a very good example of something

Shrouds- a cloth or sheet that is put round a dead body before it is buried

Elucidates- to make something clearer by explaining it

question:
Select the option that contains a grammatical error in the underlined portion.

There are three cupholders placed on the cupboards of the secretariat table.
option_1: There are three cupholders placed on the cupboards of the secretariat table.
option_2: There are three cupholders placed on the cupboards of the secretariat table.
option_3: There are three cupholders placed on the cupboards of the secretariat table.
option_4: There are three cupholdersplaced on the cupboards of the secretariat table.
solution:
(b)There are three cupholders placed on the cupboardsof the secretariat table.

There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition ‘on’ must be replaced with ‘in’. Hence, ‘in the cupboards’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

Anita is an employee who has unconditional ________ for her company.
solution:
(d)love.

‘Love’ means a strong feeling of interest in or enjoyment of something. The given sentence states that Anita is an employee who has unconditional love for her company. Hence, ‘love’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Rearrange the parts of the sentence in correct order.

The spectacular

P. Indian economy, were largely based on coal

Q. expansion of electrification of the

R. the last 20 years, and the considerable

S. Chinese economic growth of
solution:
(d)SRQP

The sentence begins with - “The spectacular” .Here spectacular is an adjective and an adjective is generally followed by more adjectives or a noun. More adjectives are available in part P and S. So the answer is either option c or option d. Part S ends in the phrase “growth of” which will be followed immediately by part R which mentions that the growth is of - the last 20 years. So S will be followed by R. S is immediately followed by R in option d. So d is the correct answer.

question:
Select the correct direct form of the given sentence.

The surgeon says that I should get anaesthesia for the surgery.
option_1: The surgeon says, “You should get anaesthesia for the surgery.”
option_2: The surgeon says, “I should get anaesthesia for the surgery.”
option_3: The surgeon said, “You should get anaesthesia for the surgery.”
option_4: The surgeon says, “You could get anaesthesia for the surgery.”
solution:
(a)The surgeon says, “You should get anaesthesia for the surgery.”

(b) The surgeon says, “I should get anaesthesia for the surgery.” (Incorrect Pronoun ‘I’)

(c) The surgeon said, “You should get anaesthesia for the surgery.” (Incorrect Reporting Verb)

(d) The surgeon says, “You couldget anaesthesia for the surgery.” (Incorrect Modal Verb)

question:
Select the correct active form of the given sentence.

Why is peace being demanded by you?
solution:
(c) Why are you demanding peace?

(a) Whyyou are demanding peace? (Incorrect Sentence Structure)

(b) Why are peace demanded? (Incorrect Verb)

(d) Why youdemand peace? (Incorrect Verb)

question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.

The WHO issued a statement on Sunday morning that though the Omicron variant of coronavirus may appear to be less severe, it should not be dismissed as ‘mild’.
solution:
(c)Gentle- calm

Severe- extremely bad

Withered- to become dry and die

Sick- not well, ill

Voracious- eating or wanting large amounts of food

question:
Select the correct passive form of the given sentence.

They fired her because she was careless.
option_1: She is being fired by them because she was careless.
option_2: She is fired by them because she was careless.
option_3: She had been fired by them because she was careless.
option_4: She was fired by them because she was careless.
solution:
(d) She was fired by them because she was careless.(correct)

(a) Sheis being fired by them because she was careless. (Incorrect Tense)

(b) She is fired by them because she was careless. (Incorrect Tense)

(c) Shehad been fired by them because she was careless. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate option to fill in the blank.

He has experienced __________ abuse.
solution:
(c)physical.

‘Physical’ means connected with your body rather than your mind. The given sentence states that he has experienced physical abuse. Hence, ‘physical’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
The question below consists of a set of labeled sentences. Out of the four options given, select the most logical order of the sentences to form a coherent paragraph.

P. You can use proper lighting, reduce screen glare, and take more breaks.

Q. However, one of the easiest habits to build is to follow the "20-20-20 rule".

R. There are lots of ways you can protect your eyes during the day.

S. Every 20 minutes of time spent staring at a screen, look away at an option that is at least 20 feet away for 20 seconds.
solution:
(c)RPQS

Sentence R will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. ways of protecting our eyes during the day. However, Sentence P states that you can use proper lighting, reduce screen glare, and take more breaks. So, P will follow R. Further, Sentence Q states that one of the easiest habits to build is to follow the "20-20-20 rule" & Sentence S states that Every 20 minutes of time spent staring at a screen, look away at an option that is at least 20 feet away for 20 seconds. So, S will follow Q. Going through the options, option c has the correct sequence.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the underlined idiom in the given sentence.

Being an ardent professional, the lawyer always kept his clientsat an arm’s length.
solution:
(b)At an arm’s length- at a distance

E.g.- My cousin’s house is at an arm’s length from my house.

question:
94.Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.

Rahul was sharing some of his childhood stories and they were hysterical.
solution:
(c)Funny- that makes you smile or laugh

Hysterical- very excited and unable to control your emotions

Emotional- connected with people’s feelings

Dangerous- likely to cause injury or damage

Scary- causing fear or alarm

question:
95.Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence.

Not only is my brother intelligentthough hard workingtoo.
solution:
(b) but hard working.

“Not only……. But also” is a fixed conjunction pair. Hence, ‘but hard working’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test : In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number.
Everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is ________ (96) fossils, which include bones, teeth, footprints, tracks, eggs, and skin impressions. For centuries, people throughout the world have ________ (97) amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Early finds inspired _______ (98) and fairy tales, and people ________ (99) that these bones belonged to ________ (100) or huge monsters.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(d)based on.

‘Based on’ means to use information to support or prove an opinion or belief. The given passage states that everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is based on fossils. Hence, ‘based on’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number.
Everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is ________ (96) fossils, which include bones, teeth, footprints, tracks, eggs, and skin impressions. For centuries, people throughout the world have ________ (97) amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Early finds inspired _______ (98) and fairy tales, and people ________ (99) that these bones belonged to ________ (100) or huge monsters.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(d)discovered.

‘Discovered’ means to find or learn something that nobody had found or knew before. The given passage states that for centuries, people throughout the world have discovered amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Hence, ‘discovered’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number.
Everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is ________ (96) fossils, which include bones, teeth, footprints, tracks, eggs, and skin impressions. For centuries, people throughout the world have ________ (97) amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Early finds inspired _______ (98) and fairy tales, and people ________ (99) that these bones belonged to ________ (100) or huge monsters.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(c)legends

‘Legends’ means old stories that may or may not be true. The given passage states that early finds inspired legends and fairy tales. Hence, ‘legends’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number.
Everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is ________ (96) fossils, which include bones, teeth, footprints, tracks, eggs, and skin impressions. For centuries, people throughout the world have ________ (97) amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Early finds inspired _______ (98) and fairy tales, and people ________ (99) that these bones belonged to ________ (100) or huge monsters.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(d)imagined

‘Imagined’ means to form a picture or idea in your mind of what something/somebody might be like. The given passage states that people imagined that these bones belonged to giants or huge monsters. Hence, ‘imagined’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test :In the following passage some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each number.
Everything we know about non-avian dinosaurs is ________ (96) fossils, which include bones, teeth, footprints, tracks, eggs, and skin impressions. For centuries, people throughout the world have ________ (97) amazing fossilized bones and footprints. Early finds inspired _______ (98) and fairy tales, and people ________ (99) that these bones belonged to ________ (100) or huge monsters.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(d)giants.

‘Giant’ means something that is very large. The given passage states that people imagined that these bones belonged to giants or huge monsters. Hence, ‘giants’ is the most appropriate answer.
